tag.name: var
tag.description: True if the daemon is in the process of exiting.

tag.description: The parent process id.

tag.description: The process id of the daemon.

tag.name: var
tag.description: True if the daemon is currently running.

docblock.description: Class constructor.

tag.name: param
tag.description: An optional argument to provide dependency injection for the application's input object. If the argument is a InputCli object that object will become the application's input object, otherwise a default input object is created.

tag.description: An optional argument to provide dependency injection for the application's config object. If the argument is a Registry object that object will become the application's config object, otherwise a default config object is created.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The received POSIX signal.

docblock.description: Check to see if the daemon is active.
docblock.long-description: This does not assume that $this daemon is active, but only if an instance of the application is active as a daemon.

tag.name: return
tag.description: True if daemon is active.

docblock.description: Execute the daemon.
Restart daemon process.
Stop daemon process.
Method to change the identity of the daemon process and resources.

tag.name: return
tag.description: True if identity successfully changed

docblock.description: Method to put the application into the background.
This is truly where the magic happens.
docblock.long-description: This is where we fork the process and kill the parent process, which is essentially what turns the application into a daemon.

docblock.description: Method to fork the process.

tag.name: return
tag.description: The child process id to the parent process, zero to the child process.

docblock.description: Method to perform basic garbage collection and memory management in the sense of clearing the stat cache.
docblock.long-description: We will probably call this method pretty regularly in our main loop.

docblock.description: Method to attach the AbstractDaemonApplication signal handler to the known signals.
docblock.long-description: Applications can override these handlers by using the pcntl_signal() function and attaching a different callback method.

docblock.description: Method to shut down the daemon and optionally restart it.

tag.name: param
tag.description: True to restart the daemon on exit.

docblock.description: Method to write the process id file out to disk.
Method to handle post-fork triggering of the onFork event.
Method to return the exit code of a terminated child process.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The status parameter is the status parameter supplied to a successful call to pcntl_waitpid().

tag.name: return
tag.description: The child process exit code.

docblock.description: Method to return the exit code of a terminated child process.

tag.name: return
tag.description: On success, the PID of the child process is returned in the parent's thread of execution, and a 0 is returned in the child's thread of execution. On failure, a -1 will be returned in the parent's context, no child process will be created, and a PHP error is raised.

docblock.description: Method to install a signal handler.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The signal number.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The signal handler which may be the name of a user created function, or method, or either of the two global constants SIG_IGN or SIG_DFL.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Specifies whether system call restarting should be used when this signal arrives.

tag.name: return
tag.description: True on success.

docblock.description: Method to wait on or return the status of a forked child.

tag.name: param
tag.description: &$status Status information.

tag.name: param
tag.description: If wait3 is available on your system (mostly BSD-style systems), you can provide the optional options parameter.

tag.name: return
tag.description: The process ID of the child which exited, -1 on error or zero if WNOHANG was provided as an option (on wait3-available systems) and no child was available.

docblock.description: Redirect to another URL.

docblock.description: Extract readable network address from the LDAP encoded networkAddress attribute.
docblock.long-description:
Please keep this document block and author attribution in place.

Novell Docs, see: http://developer.novell.com/ndk/doc/ndslib/schm_enu/data/sdk5624.html#sdk5624 for Address types: http://developer.novell.com/ndk/doc/ndslib/index.html?page=/ndk/doc/ndslib/schm_enu/data/sdk4170.html LDAP Format, String: taggedData = uint32String "#" octetstring byte 0 = uint32String = Address Type: 0= IPX Address; 1 = IP Address byte 1 = char = "#" - separator byte 2+ = octetstring - the ordinal value of the address Note: with eDirectory 8.6.2, the IP address (type 1) returns correctly, however, an IPX address does not seem to. eDir 8.7 may correct this. Enhancement made by Merijn van de Schoot: If addresstype is 8 (UDP) or 9 (TCP) do some additional parsing like still returning the IP address

tag.name: param
tag.description: The network address

tag.name: author
tag.description: Jay Burrell, Systems & Networks, Mississippi State University

docblock.description: Data\Object is a class that is used to store data but allowing you to access the data by mimicking the way PHP handles class properties.
The data object properties.
The class constructor.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Either an associative array or another object by which to set the initial properties of the new object.

docblock.description: The magic get method is used to get a data property.
docblock.long-description:
This method is a public proxy for the protected getProperty method.

Note: Magic __get does not allow recursive calls. This can be tricky because the error generated by recursing into __get is "Undefined property: {CLASS}::{PROPERTY}" which is misleading. This is relevant for this class because requesting a non-visible property can trigger a call to a sub-function. If that references the property directly in the object, it will cause a recursion into __get.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The name of the data property.

tag.name: return
tag.description: The value of the data property, or null if the data property does not exist.

docblock.long-description: This is a public proxy for the protected setProperty method.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The name of the data property.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The value to give the data property.

docblock.description: Data\Set is a collection class that allows the developer to operate on a set of Data\Object objects as if they were in a typical PHP array.
The current position of the iterator.
The iterator objects.
The class constructor.

tag.name: param
tag.description: An array of Data\Object objects to bind to the data set.

tag.name: throws
tag.description: if an object is not an instance of Data\Object.

docblock.description: The magic call method is used to call object methods using the iterator.
docblock.long-description:
Example: $array = $objectList->foo('bar');

The object list will iterate over its objects and see if each object has a callable 'foo' method. If so, it will pass the argument list and assemble any return values. If an object does not have a callable method no return value is recorded. The keys of the objects and the result array are maintained.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The name of the method called.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The arguments of the method called.

tag.name: return
tag.description: An array of values returned by the methods called on the objects in the data set.

docblock.description: The magic get method is used to get a list of properties from the objects in the data set.
docblock.long-description:
Example: $array = $dataSet->foo;

This will return a column of the values of the 'foo' property in all the objects (or values determined by custom property setters in the individual Data\Object's). The result array will contain an entry for each object in the list (compared to __call which may not). The keys of the objects and the result array are maintained.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The name of the data property.

tag.name: return
tag.description: An associative array of the values.

docblock.description: The magic isset method is used to check the state of an object property using the iterator.
docblock.long-description: Example: $array = isset($objectList->foo);

tag.name: param
tag.description: The name of the property.

tag.name: return
tag.description: True if the property is set in any of the objects in the data set.

docblock.description: The magic set method is used to set an object property using the iterator.
docblock.long-description:
Example: $objectList->foo = 'bar';

This will set the 'foo' property to 'bar' in all of the objects (or a value determined by custom property setters in the Data\Object).

tag.name: param
tag.description: The name of the property.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The value to give the data property.

docblock.description: The magic unset method is used to unset an object property using the iterator.
docblock.long-description:
Example: unset($objectList->foo);

This will unset all of the 'foo' properties in the list of Data\Object's.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The name of the property.

docblock.description: The name of the database.
The name of the database driver.
The database connection resource.
Holds the list of available db connectors.
The number of SQL statements executed by the database driver.
The database connection cursor from the last query.
The database driver debugging state.
The affected row limit for the current SQL statement.
The character(s) used to quote SQL statement names such as table names or field names, etc.
docblock.long-description: The child classes should define this as necessary. If a single character string the same character is used for both sides of the quoted name, else the first character will be used for the opening quote and the second for the closing quote.

docblock.long-description: This should be defined in child classes to hold the appropriate value for the engine.

True if the database engine supports UTF-8 character encoding.

JDatabaseDriver instances container.
The minimum supported database version.
The depth of the current transaction.
A logger.
Get a list of available database connectors.
docblock.long-description: The list will only be populated with connectors that both the class exists and the static test method returns true. This gives us the ability to have a multitude of connector classes that are self-aware as to whether or not they are able to be used on a given system.

tag.name: return
tag.description: An array of available database connectors.

docblock.description: Method to return a Driver instance based on the given options.
docblock.long-description:
There are three global options and then the rest are specific to the database driver. The 'driver' option defines which Driver class is used for the connection -- the default is 'mysqli'. The 'database' option determines which database is to be used for the connection. The 'select' option determines whether the connector should automatically select the chosen database.

Instances are unique to the given options and new objects are only created when a unique options array is passed into the method. This ensures that we don't end up with unnecessary database connection resources.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Parameters to be passed to the database driver.

docblock.description: Joomla Framework Database Factory class
Contains the current Factory instance
Method to return a Driver instance based on the given options.
docblock.long-description:
There are three global options and then the rest are specific to the database driver. The 'database' option determines which database is to be used for the connection. The 'select' option determines whether the connector should automatically select the chosen database.

Instances are unique to the given options and new objects are only created when a unique options array is passed into the method. This ensures that we don't end up with unnecessary database connection resources.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Name of the database driver you'd like to instantiate

tag.name: param
tag.description: Parameters to be passed to the database driver.

tag.name: return
tag.description: A database driver object.

docblock.description: Add a single column, or array of columns to the CALL clause of the query.
docblock.long-description:
Note that you must not mix insert, update, delete and select method calls when building a query. The call method can, however, be called multiple times in the same query.

Usage: $query->call('a.')->call('b.id'); $query->call(array('a.', 'b.id'));

tag.name: param
tag.description: A string or an array of field names.

tag.name: return
tag.description: Returns this object to allow chaining.

docblock.description: Casts a value to a char.
docblock.long-description:
Ensure that the value is properly quoted before passing to the method.

Usage: $query->select($query->castAsChar('a'));

tag.name: param
tag.description: The value to cast as a char.

tag.name: return
tag.description: Returns the cast value.

docblock.description: Gets the number of characters in a string.
docblock.long-description:
Note, use 'length' to find the number of bytes in a string.

Usage: $query->select($query->charLength('a'));

tag.name: param
tag.description: A value.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Comparison operator between charLength integer value and $condition

tag.name: param
tag.description: Integer value to compare charLength with.

tag.name: return
tag.description: The required char length call.

tag.name: param
tag.description: As separator to place between each value.

tag.name: return

docblock.description: Gets the current date and time.
docblock.long-description: Usage: $query->where('published_up < '.$query->currentTimestamp());

docblock.description: Returns a PHP date() function compliant date format for the database driver.
docblock.long-description: This method is provided for use where the query object is passed to a function for modification. If you have direct access to the database object, it is recommended you use the getDateFormat method directly.

tag.name: return
tag.description: The format string.

docblock.description: Creates a formatted dump of the query for debugging purposes.
docblock.long-description: Usage: echo $query->dump();

docblock.description: Add a table name to the DELETE clause of the query.
docblock.long-description:
Note that you must not mix insert, update, delete and select method calls when building a query.

Usage: $query->delete('#__a')->where('id = 1');

tag.name: param
tag.description: The name of the table to delete from.

tag.name: return
tag.description: Returns this object to allow chaining.

docblock.description: Method to escape a string for usage in an SQL statement.
docblock.long-description:
This method is provided for use where the query object is passed to a function for modification. If you have direct access to the database object, it is recommended you use the escape method directly.

Note that 'e' is an alias for this method as it is in JDatabaseDatabaseDriver.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The string to be escaped.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Optional parameter to provide extra escaping.

tag.name: return
tag.description: The escaped string.

tag.name: throws
tag.description: if the internal db property is not a valid object.

docblock.description: Add a single column, or array of columns to the EXEC clause of the query.
docblock.long-description:
Note that you must not mix insert, update, delete and select method calls when building a query. The exec method can, however, be called multiple times in the same query.

Usage: $query->exec('a.')->exec('b.id'); $query->exec(array('a.', 'b.id'));

tag.name: param
tag.description: A string or an array of field names.

tag.name: return
tag.description: Returns this object to allow chaining.

docblock.description: Add a table to the FROM clause of the query.
docblock.long-description:
Note that while an array of tables can be provided, it is recommended you use explicit joins.

Usage: $query->select('*')->from('#__a');

tag.name: param
tag.description: A string or array of table names. This can be a JDatabaseQuery object (or a child of it) when used as a subquery in FROM clause along with a value for $subQueryAlias.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Alias used when $tables is a JDatabaseQuery.

tag.name: return
tag.description: Returns this object to allow chaining.

docblock.description: Add a table name to the INSERT clause of the query.
docblock.long-description:
Note that you must not mix insert, update, delete and select method calls when building a query.

Usage: $query->insert('#__a')->set('id = 1'); $query->insert('#__a')->columns('id, title')->values('1,2')->values('3,4'); $query->insert('#__a')->columns('id, title')->values(array('1,2', '3,4'));

tag.name: param

This method is provided for use where the query object is passed to a function for modification. If you have direct access to the database object, it is recommended you use the nullDate method directly.

Usage: $query->where('modified_date <> '.$query->nullDate());

docblock.description: Method to quote and optionally escape a string to database requirements for insertion into the database.
docblock.long-description:
This method is provided for use where the query object is passed to a function for modification. If you have direct access to the database object, it is recommended you use the quote method directly.

Note that 'q' is an alias for this method as it is in DatabaseDriver.

Usage: $query->quote('fulltext'); $query->q('fulltext'); $query->q(array('option', 'fulltext'));

tag.name: param
tag.description: A string or an array of strings to quote.

tag.name: param
tag.description: True to escape the string, false to leave it unchanged.

tag.name: return
tag.description: The quoted input string.

tag.name: throws
tag.description: if the internal db property is not a valid object.

docblock.description: Wrap an SQL statement identifier name such as column, table or database names in quotes to prevent injection risks and reserved word conflicts.
docblock.long-description:
This method is provided for use where the query object is passed to a function for modification. If you have direct access to the database object, it is recommended you use the quoteName method directly.

Note that 'qn' is an alias for this method as it is in DatabaseDriver.

Usage: $query->quoteName('#__a'); $query->qn('#__a');

tag.name: param
tag.description: The identifier name to wrap in quotes, or an array of identifier names to wrap in quotes. Each type supports dot-notation name.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The AS query part associated to $name. It can be string or array, in latter case it has to be same length of $name; if is null there will not be any AS part for string or array element.

tag.name: return
tag.description: The quote wrapped name, same type of $name.

tag.name: throws
tag.description: if the internal db property is not a valid object.

docblock.description: Add a RIGHT JOIN clause to the query.
docblock.long-description: Usage: $query->rightJoin('b ON b.id = a.id')->rightJoin('c ON c.id = b.id');

tag.name: param
tag.description: The join condition.

tag.name: return
tag.description: Returns this object to allow chaining.

docblock.description: Add a single column, or array of columns to the SELECT clause of the query.
docblock.long-description:
Note that you must not mix insert, update, delete and select method calls when building a query. The select method can, however, be called multiple times in the same query.

Usage: $query->select('a.')->select('b.id'); $query->select(array('a.', 'b.id'));

tag.name: param
tag.description: A string or an array of field names.

tag.name: return
tag.description: Returns this object to allow chaining.

docblock.description: Add a single condition string, or an array of strings to the SET clause of the query.
docblock.long-description: Usage: $query->set('a = 1')->set('b = 2'); $query->set(array('a = 1', 'b = 2');

tag.name: param
tag.description: A string or array of string conditions.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The glue by which to join the condition strings. Defaults to ,. Note that the glue is set on first use and cannot be changed.

tag.name: return
tag.description: Returns this object to allow chaining.

docblock.description: Allows a direct query to be provided to the database driver's setQuery() method, but still allow queries to have bounded variables.
docblock.long-description: Usage: $query->setQuery('select * from #__users');

tag.name: param
tag.description: An SQL Query

tag.name: return
tag.description: Returns this object to allow chaining.

docblock.description: Add a table name to the UPDATE clause of the query.
docblock.long-description:
Note that you must not mix insert, update, delete and select method calls when building a query.

Usage: $query->update('#__foo')->set(...);

tag.name: param
tag.description: A table to update.

tag.name: return
tag.description: Returns this object to allow chaining.

docblock.description: Adds a tuple, or array of tuples that would be used as values for an INSERT INTO statement.
docblock.long-description: Usage: $query->values('1,2,3')->values('4,5,6'); $query->values(array('1,2,3', '4,5,6'));

tag.name: param
tag.description: A single tuple, or array of tuples.

tag.name: return
tag.description: Returns this object to allow chaining.

docblock.description: Add a single condition, or an array of conditions to the WHERE clause of the query.
docblock.long-description: Usage: $query->where('a = 1')->where('b = 2'); $query->where(array('a = 1', 'b = 2'));

tag.name: param
tag.description: A string or array of where conditions.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The glue by which to join the conditions. Defaults to AND. Note that the glue is set on first use and cannot be changed.

tag.name: return
tag.description: Returns this object to allow chaining.

docblock.description: Method to provide deep copy support to nested objects and arrays when cloning.
Add a query to UNION with the current query.
docblock.long-description:
Multiple unions each require separate statements and create an array of unions.

Usage: $query->union('SELECT name FROM #__foo') $query->union('SELECT name FROM #__foo','distinct') $query->union(array('SELECT name FROM #__foo', 'SELECT name FROM #__bar'))

tag.name: param
tag.description: The Query object or string to union.

tag.name: param
tag.description: True to only return distinct rows from the union.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The glue by which to join the conditions.

tag.name: return
tag.description: The Query object on success or boolean false on failure.

docblock.description: Add a query to UNION DISTINCT with the current query.
docblock.long-description:
Simply a proxy to Union with the Distinct clause.

Usage: $query->unionDistinct('SELECT name FROM #__foo')

tag.name: param
tag.description: The Query object or string to union.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The glue by which to join the conditions.

tag.name: return
tag.description: The Query object on success or boolean false on failure.

docblock.description: Find and replace sprintf-like tokens in a format string.
docblock.long-description:
Each token takes one of the following forms: %% - A literal percent character. %[t] - Where [t] is a type specifier. %[n]$[x] - Where [n] is an argument specifier and [t] is a type specifier.

Types: a - Numeric: Replacement text is coerced to a numeric type but not quoted or escaped. e - Escape: Replacement text is passed to $this->escape(). E - Escape (extra): Replacement text is passed to $this->escape() with true as the second argument. n - Name Quote: Replacement text is passed to $this->quoteName(). q - Quote: Replacement text is passed to $this->quote(). Q - Quote (no escape): Replacement text is passed to $this->quote() with false as the second argument. r - Raw: Replacement text is used as-is. (Be careful)

Date Types: - Replacement text automatically quoted (use uppercase for Name Quote). - Replacement text should be a string in date format or name of a date column. y/Y - Year m/M - Month d/D - Day h/H - Hour i/I - Minute s/S - Second

Invariable Types: - Takes no argument. - Argument index not incremented. t - Replacement text is the result of $this->currentTimestamp(). z - Replacement text is the result of $this->nullDate(false). Z - Replacement text is the result of $this->nullDate(true).

Usage: $query->format('SELECT %1$n FROM %2$n WHERE %3$n = %4$a', 'foo', '#__foo', 'bar', 1); Returns: SELECT foo FROM #__foo WHERE bar = 1

Notes: The argument specifier is optional but recommended for clarity. The argument index used for unspecified tokens is incremented only when used.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The formatting string.

tag.name: return
tag.description: Returns a string produced according to the formatting string.

markers.todo: - What to do? sprintf() throws a Warning in these cases.

docblock.description: Implementation of an immutable Event.

An immutable event cannot be modified after instanciation :

docblock.description: Returns the current position of the file read/write pointer.
File write
docblock.long-description: Whilst this function accepts a reference, the underlying fwrite will do a copy! This will roughly double the memory allocation for any write you do. Specifying chunked will get around this by only writing in specific chunk sizes. This defaults to 8192 which is a sane number to use most of the time (change the default with JStream::set('chunksize', newsize);) Note: This doesn't support gzip/bzip2 writing like reading does

docblock.description: Form Class for the Joomla Framework.
docblock.long-description: This class implements a robust API for constructing, populating, filtering, and validating forms. It uses XML definitions to construct form fields and a variety of field and rule classes to render and validate the form.

If the form control is set to 'joomla' however, the fields would be rendered like: and .

docblock.description: Method to load the form description from an XML string or object.
docblock.long-description: The replace option works per field. If a field being loaded already exists in the current form definition then the behavior or load will vary depending upon the replace flag. If it is set to true, then the existing field will be replaced in its exact location by the new field being loaded. If it is false, then the new field being loaded will be ignored and the method will move on to the next field to load.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The name of an XML string or object.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Flag to toggle whether form fields should be replaced if a field already exists with the same group/name.

tag.name: param
tag.description: An optional xpath to search for the fields.

tag.name: return
tag.description: True on success, false otherwise.

docblock.description: Method to load the form description from an XML file.
docblock.long-description: The reset option works on a group basis. If the XML file references groups that have already been created they will be replaced with the fields in the new XML file unless the $reset parameter has been set to false.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The filesystem path of an XML file.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Flag to toggle whether form fields should be replaced if a field already exists with the same group/name.

tag.name: param
tag.description: An optional xpath to search for the fields.

tag.name: return
tag.description: True on success, false otherwise.

docblock.description: JForm's helper class.
docblock.long-description: Provides a storage for filesystem's paths where JForm's entities reside and methods for creating those entities. Also stores objects with entities' prototypes for further reusing.

docblock.long-description:
Array's structure:

paths:
{ENTITY_NAME}:
- /path/1
- /path/2

docblock.description: Static array of JForm's entity objects for re-use.
docblock.long-description:
Prototypes for all fields and rules are here.

Array's structure:

entities:
{ENTITY_NAME}:
{KEY}: {OBJECT}

Option values related to the generation of HTML output.
docblock.long-description: Recognized options are: fmtDepth, integer. The current indent depth. fmtEol, string. The end of line string, default is linefeed. fmtIndent, string. The string to use for indentation, default is tab.

property.name: $optionDefaults
property.default: array('option' => array('option.attr' => null, 'option.disable' => 'disable', 'option.id' => null, 'option.key' => 'value', 'option.key.toHtml' => true, 'option.label' => null, 'option.label.toHtml' => true, 'option.text' => 'text', 'option.text.toHtml' => true))

docblock.description: Default values for options.
docblock.long-description: Organized by option group.

docblock.description: Generates an HTML selection list.

tag.name: param
tag.description: An array of objects, arrays, or scalars.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The value of the HTML name attribute.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Additional HTML attributes for the <select> tag. This can be an array of attributes, or an array of options. Treated as options if it is the last argument passed. Valid options are: Format options, see {@see Select::$formatOptions}. Selection options, see {@see Select::options()}. list.attr, string|array: Additional attributes for the select element. id, string: Value to use as the select element id attribute. Defaults to the same as the name. list.select, string|array: Identifies one or more option elements to be selected, based on the option key values.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The name of the object variable for the option value. If set to null, the index of the value array is used.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The name of the object variable for the option text.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The key that is selected (accepts an array or a string).

tag.name: param
tag.description: Value of the field id or null by default

tag.name: param
tag.description: True to translate

tag.name: return
tag.description: HTML for the select list.

docblock.description: Generates a grouped HTML selection list from nested arrays.

tag.name: param
tag.description: An array of groups, each of which is an array of options.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The value of the HTML name attribute

tag.name: param
tag.description: Options, an array of key/value pairs. Valid options are: Format options, {@see Select::$formatOptions}. Selection options. See {@see Select::options()}. group.id: The property in each group to use as the group id attribute. Defaults to none. group.label: The property in each group to use as the group label. Defaults to "text". If set to null, the data array index key is used. group.items: The property in each group to use as the array of items in the group. Defaults to "items". If set to null, group.id and group. label are forced to null and the data element is assumed to be a list of selections. id: Value to use as the select element id attribute. Defaults to the same as the name. list.attr: Attributes for the select element. Can be a string or an array of key/value pairs. Defaults to none. list.select: either the value of one selected option or an array of selected options. Default: none. list.translate: Boolean. If set, text and labels are translated via Text::_().

tag.name: return
tag.description: HTML for the select list

tag.name: throws
tag.description: If a group has contents that cannot be processed.

tag.description: The value of the HTML name attribute

docblock.description: Create an object that represents an option in an option list.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The value of the option

tag.name: param
tag.description: The text for the option

tag.name: param
tag.description: If a string, the returned object property name for the value. If an array, options. Valid options are: attr: String|array. Additional attributes for this option. Defaults to none. disable: Boolean. If set, this option is disabled. label: String. The value for the option label. option.attr: The property in each option array to use for additional selection attributes. Defaults to none. option.disable: The property that will hold the disabled state. Defaults to "disable". option.key: The property that will hold the selection value. Defaults to "value". option.label: The property in each option array to use as the selection label attribute. If a "label" option is provided, defaults to "label", if no label is given, defaults to null (none). option.text: The property that will hold the the displayed text. Defaults to "text". If set to null, the option array is assumed to be a list of displayable scalars.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The property that will hold the the displayed text. This parameter is ignored if an options array is passed.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Not used.

docblock.description: Generates the option tags for an HTML select list (with no select tag surrounding the options).

tag.name: param
tag.description: An array of objects, arrays, or values.

tag.name: param
tag.description: If a string, this is the name of the object variable for the option value. If null, the index of the array of objects is used. If an array, this is a set of options, as key/value pairs. Valid options are: -Format options, {@see Select::$formatOptions}. -groups: Boolean. If set, looks for keys with the value "<optgroup>" and synthesizes groups from them. Deprecated. Defaults true for backwards compatibility. -list.select: either the value of one selected option or an array of selected options. Default: none. -list.translate: Boolean. If set, text and labels are translated via Text::_(). Default is false. -option.id: The property in each option array to use as the selection id attribute. Defaults to none. -option.key: The property in each option array to use as the selection value. Defaults to "value". If set to null, the index of the option array is used. -option.label: The property in each option array to use as the selection label attribute. Defaults to null (none). -option.text: The property in each option array to use as the displayed text. Defaults to "text". If set to null, the option array is assumed to be a list of displayable scalars. -option.attr: The property in each option array to use for additional selection attributes. Defaults to none. -option.disable: The property that will hold the disabled state. Defaults to "disable". -option.key: The property that will hold the selection value. Defaults to "value". -option.text: The property that will hold the the displayed text. Defaults to "text". If set to null, the option array is assumed to be a list of displayable scalars.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The name of the object variable for the option text.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The key that is selected (accepts an array or a string)

tag.name: param
tag.description: Translate the option values.

tag.name: return
tag.description: HTML for the select list

docblock.description: List all of the activities in the specified collection for a particular user.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The ID of the user to get activities for. The special value "me" can be used to indicate the authenticated user.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The collection of activities to list. Acceptable values are: "public".

tag.name: param
tag.description: Used to specify the fields you want returned.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The maximum number of people to include in the response, used for paging.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The continuation token, used to page through large result sets. To get the next page of results, set this parameter to the value of "nextPageToken" from the previous response. This token may be of any length.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Specifies an alternative representation type. Acceptable values are: "json" - Use JSON format (default)

tag.name: return
tag.description: Data from Google

docblock.description: Get an activity.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The ID of the activity to get.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Used to specify the fields you want returned.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Specifies an alternative representation type. Acceptable values are: "json" - Use JSON format (default)

tag.name: return
tag.description: Data from Google

docblock.description: Search all public activities.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Full-text search query string.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Used to specify the fields you want returned.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Specify the preferred language to search with. https://developers.google.com/+/api/search#available-languages

tag.name: param
tag.description: The maximum number of people to include in the response, used for paging.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Specifies how to order search results. Acceptable values are "best" and "recent".

tag.name: param
tag.description: The continuation token, used to page through large result sets. To get the next page of results, set this parameter to the value of "nextPageToken" from the previous response. This token may be of any length.

tag.name: return

Constructor.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Array of configuration parameters (Optional)

docblock.description: Sets a value

tag.name: param
tag.description: Name of the value to set.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Value to assign to the input.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The time the cookie expires. This is a Unix timestamp so is in number of seconds since the epoch. In other words, you'll most likely set this with the time() function plus the number of seconds before you want it to expire. Or you might use mktime(). time()+60*60*24*30 will set the cookie to expire in 30 days. If set to 0, or omitted, the cookie will expire at the end of the session (when the browser closes).

tag.name: param
tag.description: The path on the server in which the cookie will be available on. If set to '/', the cookie will be available within the entire domain. If set to '/foo/', the cookie will only be available within the /foo/ directory and all sub-directories such as /foo/bar/ of domain. The default value is the current directory that the cookie is being set in.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The domain that the cookie is available to. To make the cookie available on all subdomains of example.com (including example.com itself) then you'd set it to '.example.com'. Although some browsers will accept cookies without the initial ., RFC 2109 requires it to be included. Setting the domain to 'www.example.com' or '.www.example.com' will make the cookie only available in the www subdomain.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Indicates that the cookie should only be transmitted over a secure HTTPS connection from the client. When set to TRUE, the cookie will only be set if a secure connection exists. On the server-side, it's on the programmer to send this kind of cookie only on secure connection (e.g. with respect to $_SERVER["HTTPS"]).

tag.name: param
tag.description: When TRUE the cookie will be made accessible only through the HTTP protocol. This means that the cookie won't be accessible by scripting languages, such as JavaScript. This setting can effectively help to reduce identity theft through XSS attacks (although it is not supported by all browsers).

docblock.description: Like JText::sprintf but tries to pluralise the string.
docblock.long-description:
Note that this method can take a mixed number of arguments as for the sprintf function.

The last argument can take an array of options:

array('jsSafe'=>boolean, 'interpretBackSlashes'=>boolean, 'script'=>boolean)

where:

jsSafe is a boolean to generate a javascript safe strings. interpretBackSlashes is a boolean to interpret backslashes \->\, \n->new line, \t->tabulation. script is a boolean to indicate that the string will be push in the javascript language store.

Examples: will generate an alert message containing '1 plugin successfully disabled' it will generate a '1 plugin successfully disabled' string

tag.name: param
tag.description: The format string.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The number of items

tag.name: return
tag.description: The translated strings or the key if 'script' is true in the array of options

docblock.description: Joomla! Log Class
docblock.long-description: This class hooks into the global log configuration settings to allow for user configured logging events to be sent to where the user wishes them to be sent. On high load sites Syslog is probably the best (pure PHP function), then the text file based loggers (CSV, W3c or plain Formattedtext) and finally MySQL offers the most features (e.g. rapid searching) but will incur a performance hit due to INSERT being issued.

docblock.description: Frees all session variables and destroys all data registered to a session
docblock.long-description: This method resets the $_SESSION variable and destroys all of the data associated with the current session in its storage (file or DB). It forces new session to be started after this method is called. It does not unset the session cookie.

docblock.description: Writes session data and ends session
docblock.long-description: Session data is usually stored after your script terminated without the need to call JSession::close(), but as session data is locked to prevent concurrent writes only one script may operate on a session at any time. When using framesets together with sessions you will experience the frames loading one by one due to this locking. You can reduce the time needed to load all the frames by ending the session as soon as all changes to session variables are done.

docblock.description: Joomla Framework String Normalise Class
Method to convert a string from camel case.
docblock.long-description:
This method offers two modes. Grouped allows for splitting on groups of uppercase characters as follows:

"FooBarABCDef" becomes array("Foo", "Bar", "ABC", "Def") "JFooBar" becomes array("J", "Foo", "Bar") "J001FooBar002" becomes array("J001", "Foo", "Bar002") "abcDef" becomes array("abc", "Def") "abc_defGhi_Jkl" becomes array("abc_def", "Ghi_Jkl") "ThisIsA_NASAAstronaut" becomes array("This", "Is", "A_NASA", "Astronaut")) "JohnFitzgerald_Kennedy" becomes array("John", "Fitzgerald_Kennedy"))

Non-grouped will split strings at each uppercase character.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The string input (ASCII only).

tag.name: param
tag.description: Optionally allows splitting on groups of uppercase characters.

tag.name: return
tag.description: The space separated string.

docblock.description: Tests whether a string contains only 7bit ASCII bytes.
docblock.long-description:
You might use this to conditionally check whether a string needs handling as UTF-8 or not, potentially offering performance benefits by using the native PHP equivalent if it's just ASCII e.g.;

if (String::is_ascii($someString))
{
    // It's just ASCII - use the native PHP version
    $someString = strtolower($someString);
}
else
{
    $someString = String::strtolower($someString);
}

tag.name: param
tag.description: The string to test.

tag.name: return
tag.description: True if the string is all ASCII

tag.name: return
tag.description: true if valid

docblock.description: Tests whether a string complies as UTF-8.
docblock.long-description: This will be much faster than utf8_is_valid but will pass five and six octet UTF-8 sequences, which are not supported by Unicode and so cannot be displayed correctly in a browser. In other words it is not as strict as utf8_is_valid but it's faster. If you use it to validate user input, you place yourself at the risk that attackers will be able to inject 5 and 6 byte sequences (which may or may not be a significant risk, depending on what you are are doing)

tag.name: param
tag.description: UTF-8 string to check

tag.name: return
tag.description: TRUE if string is valid UTF-8

docblock.description: Takes an associative array of arrays and inverts the array keys to values using the array values as keys.
docblock.long-description:
Example: $input = array( 'New' => array('1000', '1500', '1750'), 'Used' => array('3000', '4000', '5000', '6000') ); $output = ArrayHelper::invert($input);

Output would be equal to: $output = array( '1000' => 'New', '1500' => 'New', '1750' => 'New', '3000' => 'Used', '4000' => 'Used', '5000' => 'Used', '6000' => 'Used' );

tag.name: param
tag.description: The source array.

tag.name: return
tag.description: The inverted array.
